cardseteditor

Class EditableCardSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • cardseteditor.EditableCardSet

  • public class EditableCardSet
extends Object
    This class contains the information which is to be written to a card set file..
    Since:
    5.0
    Version:
    5.0
    Author:
    David E. Reese

    • Method Detail

      • setSideTitle

        public void setSideTitle(int theSide,
                String theTitle)
                  throws Error
        This method sets the title for a side of the cards in the card set.
        Parameters:
        theSide - Number of the side (1-3).
        theTitle - Title of the side.
        Throws:
        Error - Thrown if theSide not in the range 1..3.

      • getSideTitle

        public String getSideTitle(int theSide)
                    throws Error
        This method returns a string containing the title of a side.
        Parameters:
        theSide - Number of the side (1..3).
        Returns:
        Title of the side.
        Throws:
        Error - Thrown if theSide not in the range 1..3.

      • appendCard

        public int appendCard(String side1,
             String side2,
             String side3)
        This method appends a new card onto the end of the card set.
        Parameters:
        side1 - Text for side 1 of the card.
        side2 - Text for side 2 of the card.
        side3 - Text for side 3 of the card.
        Returns:
        Number of cards in the set after data is added.

      • getCardSideText

        public String getCardSideText(int theCard,
                     int theSide)
                       throws Error
        This method returns the text for a side of a given card.
        Parameters:
        theCard - Number of the card (>= 1 and <= number of cards in set).
        theSide - Side of the card (1..3)
        Returns:
        Text for the card side.
        Throws:
        Error - Thrown if theCard is out of range or theSide is out of range.

      • getNumCards

        public int getNumCards()
        This method returns the number of cards in the card set.
        Returns:
        Number of cards.
